def greet(name):

def greet(name):
    name = name.lower()
    return "Hello " + name[0].upper() + name[1:] + "!"
    
    
print((greet("BILLY")))

def greet(name): 
    name = name.lower() # Converts all letters to lowercase
    for i in name: #Loops through each letter in the given word
        o = name[0].upper() + name[1:] #Converts first letter to uppercase
    return f"Hello {o}!"

def greet(name): 
    # use name.lower().capitalize() to make all low case and to capitalize afterwards
    # assign Hello (the space between Hello and name) and the exclamation sign
    greet = "Hello"
    space = " "
    ex_sign = "!"
    return greet + space + name.lower().capitalize() + ex_sign

def greet(name): 
    c=name.lower()
    l=[]
    for i in c:
        l.append(i)
    l[0]=l[0].upper()
    a="".join(l)
    b="Hello "+a+"!"
    return b

def greet(name): 
    name = name.lower()
    a = name[0].upper()
    b = list(name)
    b.pop(0)
    b = ''.join(b)
    final = a + b
    return 'Hello ' + final + '!'
    pass
